001package io.jstach.rainbowgum;
002
003import java.net.URI;
004
005import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogEncoder.AbstractEncoder;
006import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogEncoder.Buffer.StringBuilderBuffer;
007
008/**
009 * Encodes a {@link LogEvent} into a buffer of its choosing. While the {@link Buffer} does
010 * not need to be thread-safe the encoder itself should be.
011 * <p>
012 * An appender typically calls an encoder by first {@linkplain #buffer() creating a
013 * buffer} that the encoder knows about or reusing an existing {@link Buffer} the encoder
014 * knows about.
015 * <p>
016 * The {@linkplain #encode(LogEvent, Buffer) encoding into a buffer} typically happens
017 * outside of lock to minimize lock contention. Thus the appender promises not to share a
018 * buffer at the same time with other threads as well as only use a buffer the log encoder
019 * created at some point.
020 * <p>
021 * Once encoding is done the appender than typically enters into a lock (appenders
022 * attached to an async publisher may not need to use a lock) where the appender will ask
023 * the buffer to {@linkplain Buffer#drain(LogOutput, LogEvent) drain} its contents into
024 * the output.
025 * <p>
026 * Because {@link Buffer} is not a specific implementation the Encoder typically casts the
027 * buffer to the expected concrete implementation. {@link AbstractEncoder} can make this
028 * logic easier and is recommended to extend it.
029 * <p>
030 * Given the complexity of encoders it is recommend use the much easier to implement
031 * interface of {@link LogFormatter} and convert it to an encoder with
032 * {@link #of(LogFormatter)}.
033 *
034 * @see LogFormatter
035 * @see Buffer
036 * @see LogAppender
037 * @see StringBuilderBuffer
038 */
039public interface LogEncoder {
040
041        /**
042         * Creates a <strong>new</strong> buffer. The encoder should not try to reuse buffers
043         * as that is the responsibility of the {@linkplain LogAppender appender} (and
044         * possibly {@link LogOutput} but usually not).
045         * @return a new buffer.
046         */
047        public Buffer buffer();
048
049        /**
050         * Encodes an event to the buffer. It is recommended that the encoder call
051         * {@link Buffer#clear()} before using.
052         * @param event log event.
053         * @param buffer buffer created from {@link #buffer()}.
054         */
055        public void encode(LogEvent event, Buffer buffer);
056
057        /**
058         * Creates an encoder from a formatter.
059         * @param formatter formatter.
060         * @return encoder.
061         */
062        public static LogEncoder of(LogFormatter formatter) {
063                return new FormatterEncoder(formatter);
064        }
065
066        /**
067         * Provides a lazy loaded encoder from a URI.
068         * @param uri uri.
069         * @return provider of encoder.
070         */
071        public static LogConfig.Provider<LogEncoder> of(URI uri) {
072                return (s, c) -> {
073                        return c.encoderRegistry().provide(uri, s, c.properties());
074                };
075        }
076
077        /**
078         * Finds output based on URI.
079         */
080        public interface EncoderProvider extends PluginProvider<LogEncoder, RuntimeException> {
081
082                /**
083                 * Loads an encoder from a URI.
084                 * @param uri uri.
085                 * @param name name of encoder.
086                 * @param properties key value config.
087                 * @return output.
088                 */
089                @Override
090                LogEncoder provide(URI uri, String name, LogProperties properties);
091
092        }
093
094        /**
095         * Encoders buffer.
096         */
097        public interface Buffer extends AutoCloseable {
098
099                /**
100                 * The appender will call this usually within a lock to transfer content from the
101                 * buffer to the output.
102                 * @param output output to receive content.
103                 * @param event log event.
104                 */
105                public void drain(LogOutput output, LogEvent event);
106
107                /**
108                 * Prepare the buffer for reuse.
109                 * <p>
110                 * An appender may not call clear before being passed to the encoder so the
111                 * encoder should do its own clearing.
112                 */
113                public void clear();
114
115                /**
116                 * Convenience that will call clear.
117                 */
118                @Override
119                default void close() {
120                        clear();
121                }
122
123                /**
124                 * A buffer that simply wraps a {@link StringBuilder}. Direct access to the
125                 * {@link StringBuilder} is available as the field {@link #stringBuilder}.
126                 *
127                 * @see AbstractEncoder
128                 */
129                public final class StringBuilderBuffer implements Buffer {
130
131                        /**
132                         * Underlying StringBuilder.
133                         */
134                        public final StringBuilder stringBuilder;
135
136                        /**
137                         * Creates a StringBuilder based buffer.
138                         * @param sb string builder.
139                         * @return buffer.
140                         */
141                        public static StringBuilderBuffer of(StringBuilder sb) {
142                                return new StringBuilderBuffer(sb);
143                        }
144
145                        private StringBuilderBuffer(StringBuilder stringBuilder) {
146                                super();
147                                this.stringBuilder = stringBuilder;
148                        }
149
150                        @Override
151                        public void drain(LogOutput output, LogEvent event) {
152                                output.write(event, stringBuilder.toString());
153                        }
154
155                        @Override
156                        public void clear() {
157                                stringBuilder.setLength(0);
158                        }
159
160                }
161
162        }
163
164        /**
165         * Abstract encoder that will cast the buffer to the desired implementation. Extend to
166         * make creating encoders easier.
167         *
168         * @param <T> buffer type.
169         */
170        abstract class AbstractEncoder<T extends Buffer> implements LogEncoder {
171
172                /**
173                 * Do nothing constructor.
174                 */
175                protected AbstractEncoder() {
176
177                }
178
179                /**
180                 * Create a specific buffer implementation.
181                 * @return buffer
182                 */
183                protected abstract T doBuffer();
184
185                /**
186                 * A type safe version of {@link #encode(LogEvent, Buffer)}.
187                 * @param event event.
188                 * @param buffer casted buffer.
189                 */
190                protected abstract void doEncode(LogEvent event, T buffer);
191
192                @Override
193                public final Buffer buffer() {
194                        return doBuffer();
195                }
196
197                @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
198                @Override
199                public final void encode(LogEvent event, Buffer buffer) {
200                        doEncode(event, (T) buffer);
201
202                }
203
204        }
205
206}
207
208final class FormatterEncoder extends AbstractEncoder<StringBuilderBuffer> {
209
210        private final LogFormatter formatter;
211
212        public FormatterEncoder(LogFormatter formatter) {
213                super();
214                this.formatter = formatter;
215        }
216
217        @Override
218        protected void doEncode(LogEvent event, StringBuilderBuffer buffer) {
219                buffer.clear();
220                StringBuilder sb = buffer.stringBuilder;
221                formatter.format(sb, event);
222        }
223
224        @Override
225        protected StringBuilderBuffer doBuffer() {
226                return StringBuilderBuffer.of(new StringBuilder());
227        }
228
229}
